title: ‘Significantly higher’ carbon tax needed to address climate change: IMF’s Georgieva
text:
Washington (AFP) – Addressing the climate crisis will require a change in national tax systems that includes a big ramp-up in levies on carbon emissions, IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva said Tuesday.

“It is a crisis where no one is immune and everyone has a responsibility to act,” she said in a speech ahead of annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank next week.

“Limiting global warming to a safe level requires a significantly higher carbon price,” she said. But she added that “the key here is to change tax systems, not simply add a new tax.”
